utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Gentlemen.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: If any of you are looking for something to do on Valentine’s Day, Amy and I’ll be streaming our first-ever live episode of Fun With Flags. You’re welcome to join us as we celebrate the timeless love affair between wind and flapping fabric.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Penny and I have dinner reservations that night, but any other time, no.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sorry, Bernie and I are breaking in the new hot tub, if you know what I mean.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Not a clue. Raj?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Spending Valentine’s Day with Emily.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You don’t sound very excited about it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, I am, I am. I, I guess I’m still wondering if Emily and I are right for each other.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Does this have to do with that girl you had coffee with?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You mean the strong, sexy angel I can’t stop thinking about? Who can say?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You’ve been talking about breaking up with Emily forever. Why don’t you just do it already?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, just get it over with.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, you say it like it’s easy. Have any one of you ever broken up with anyone?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Not really.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know, uh, once I ordered an Uber by accident. I just got in and went somewhere.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So, you really gonna break up with her?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, I think so. Do you have any advice?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, I have broken up with my fair share of guys. I mean, how many times did I break up with Leonard?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I stopped counting at four.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, my advice to you is do it at her place so you can leave when you need to, uh, tell the truth, make it quick and be prepared for tears.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, I’m gonna do a pre-cry before I go in there. Really dry myself out.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: She meant Emily.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, I, I really didn’t.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: You’re seriously breaking up with me?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: And you thought right before Valentine’s Day was a good time to do it?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You’re right, let’s talk again in a few days.

utterance.speaker: Raj (on phone)
utterance.content: Hey, Claire. Hi. It’s, it’s Rajesh. I was, I was wondering if you’re free for Valentine’s Day?

utterance.speaker: Claire
utterance.content: Sorry, I just got back with my boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: But I just broke up with my girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: Claire
utterance.content: Right before Valentine’s Day? What an ass.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Please take me back. Our love was meant to be.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m gonna all alone on Valentine’s Day.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, you were right, tears.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Okay, and we are live in 22 minutes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m nervous. I hope people will be around to watch even though it’s Valentine’s Day.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: People who are fans of an Internet show about flags? Trust me, they’re around.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, and speaking of Valentine’s Day, I haven’t forgotten about you tonight.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, you’ve become such an integral part of my life as well as this show, I felt it only right to include your name in the title.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh. That is so sweet.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So from now on, this program will be officially known as Dr. Sheldon Cooper and Dr. Amy Farrah Fowler present Dr. Sheldon’ Cooper’s Fun With Flags.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Catchy.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m gonna check the temp on the tub.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Don’t make it too hot.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sorry, but too hot is the only temperature I come in.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Look at that, you shaved it all.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You’re welcome. Um, question, this is my first hot tub, is it supposed to come with a rat flopping around in it?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Ew, really? Get it out.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: How?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Uh, wish we had a skimmer.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Uh, you turn off the jets, I’ll get a strainer from the kitchen.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I don’t know how to turn off the jets.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Good, I don’t know where we keep the strainer.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Excuse me. Uh, bad news. The maître d’ said it’s gonna be at least an hour.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: An hour? What? That’s crazy. We have a reservation.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So what did you say?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thanks, sorry to bother you. But I said it like a badass.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, well, can’t you, like, slip him some money or something?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really? I’ve never done that before. Does it work?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Do people like money? Is that what you’re asking?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: A lot of attitude from the woman who thought MC squared was a rapper.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Now, is that a smart thing to say on a holiday that’s basically national sex night?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m sorry. You’re pretty, I’m stupid. Hello. Uh, just checking again for Hofstadter. Still gonna be an hour?

utterance.speaker: Maitre d’
utterance.content: I’m afraid so.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay. Thanks. Hey. I think you may have dropped this?

utterance.speaker: Maitre d’
utterance.content: Oh. Did anybody lose a 20?

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: I did.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, I took care of it.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Okay, we are live in five, four, three, oh, wait, oh shoot, I already pushed the button. Never mind, we’re live.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Uh, hello and welcome to a special live edition of Dr. Sheldon Cooper…

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: And Dr. Amy Farrah Fowler present…

utterance.speaker: Together
utterance.content: Dr. Sheldon Cooper’s Fun With Flags.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Consider tonight’s episode a Valentine’s Day gift for you, our viewers.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s also my gift to you. That was clear, right? ‘Cause you’re not getting anything else.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Since we’re live, you’ll finally be able to reach out to us with your flag thoughts and flag questions.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Allow us to answer a few quick ones that we get all the time. Uh, uh, yes, I really am a doctor. Uh, yes, she really is my girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No, I just blink a lot, it’s not Morse code for rescue me. Oh, uh, ok, uh, here’s our first call. Hello, and welcome to Fun With Flags. What’s your question?

utterance.speaker: Raj (voice)
utterance.content: What is wrong with me? Why am I so self-destructive?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Rajesh?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yes. Whenever things are going well, I always find a way to ruin it. You two look happy, how do you do it?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I, I think it starts with good communication.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know what, that’s not a flag question. Next caller.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I hope you don’t think I’m just saying this because it’s Valentine’s Day, but, I love you so much.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I’m gonna put this down your robe. It’s not moving, but I think it’s still alive.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, should we put it back in there a few minutes?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No. No, and it’s not a rat, it’s a rabbit. We need to save it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, how do we do that?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Um, I don’t know, look it up on your phone. I’m gonna wrap it in a towel.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Um, taking care of injured rabbit. Okay. Make sure it’s comfortable and warm. Well, it was just in a hot tub. I’m gonna say check.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Anything else?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: To make sure it’s not dehydrated, feed him an electrolyte solution. If it’s not responding, use a warm cloth to wash its face and genitals. Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: This is ridiculous. You know, I’m gonna go talk to the maître d’.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What are you gonna say?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t know. I’m, I’m gonna flirt with him.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know if I’m comfortable with that.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m still sleeping with you tonight.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: See if you can get a table by the window.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hi there. What’s your name?

utterance.speaker: Maitre d’
utterance.content: Glen.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, boy, it is crazy in here tonight, huh, Glen?

utterance.speaker: Maitre d’
utterance.content: Well, you know, Valentine’s Day.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes. Oh, bet your girlfriend is super bummed you had to work tonight. Anyway, look, we have been waiting a while, and I just…

utterance.speaker: Maitre d’
utterance.content: With all due respect, ma’am, there’s nothing I can do.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You don’t have to call me ma’am.

utterance.speaker: Maitre d’
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I mean, we’re basically the same age.

utterance.speaker: Maitre d’
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: How old are you?

utterance.speaker: Maitre d’
utterance.content: I’m 21. How old are you?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Just shut up, Glen. Come on, let’s get out of here.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What? Why?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Because I’m young. Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Rajesh, it’s perfectly normal to have doubts after breaking up with someone.

utterance.speaker: Raj (voice)
utterance.content: You really think so?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, you know what’s not normal? Blubbering about emotions during a flag show. Unless that emotion is excitement over New Zealand changing their flag. Yeah, good luck, you crazy Kiwis, we’re rooting for you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Your friend is hurting.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, Sheldon’s right. Emily did say I always talk about my feelings too much.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I suppose that could be a legitimate concern in a relationship. Uh, perhaps even a, a red flag. And speaking of red flags, check out this sexy number from the former Soviet Union. Hubba, hubba.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh. Uh, we-we have another caller. Hi. You’re on Fun with Flags.

utterance.speaker: Barry (voice)
utterance.content: Hewwo. I want to talk about how wonewy I am, too.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Kripke? Is that you?

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m just sitting here all by myself wondering if I’w ever find someone to share my wife with. Pwefewabwy Asian, 18-24, no fatties.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Please, all comments and questions should be flag-related.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Aw wight. Is my pole fwag-wewated?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t see why not.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: He’s eating. That’s a good sign.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You’re gonna have to wait one hour until you can go swimming again.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: He’s pretty cute.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: He is. Should we name him?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: It is Valentine’s Day. How about Valentino?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Nice. A classic rabbit name. Peter Rabbit, Roger Rabbit. Valentino Wolowitz Rabbit. Oh, look at all that chest hair and overbite. Of course you’re a Wolowitz. Son of a bitch, he bit me.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, I’m not okay. Wild rabbits can have rabies.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh. Well, why did you put your finger near its mouth?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Poor judgement, obviously.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: He’s so little. I’m sure it’s fine.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: How can it be fine? I just got attacked by a clearly anti-Semitic wild animal.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s not what we planned, but this isn’t so bad, right?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It is freaking amazing.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, glad you’re feeling better.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I was just hungry and cranky, and I’ve never been called ma’am before.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Is that a big deal?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Kind of. When was the first time someone called you sir?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sixth grade, but I wore a sport coat and carried a briefcase, so…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Can you believe when I met you I was 22? I mean, it’s crazy. Where did all that time go?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Mm, you watched The Bachelor a lot.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, go ahead and make jokes, but your thirties are almost over.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, they’re not.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You’re closer to 40 than you are 30.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Ha, ha. You married an old man. Tell you what. Let’s do something fun tonight.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Won’t make us any younger.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, maybe not, but some day we actually will be old, and we’ll look back on this night and remember what a good time we had.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, like what?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I know. Food fight. I’ll keep thinking.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Look, I know you both feel bad about being alone, but sometimes the best thing you can do is take a little time for yourself, especially when you just got out of a relationship.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Speaking of ending relationships, when British Honduras became Belize, they designed a new flag with a tree on it, and I would like to hang myself from that tree.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: But, Amy, when you and Sheldon split up, didn’t you start dating someone right away?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, I, I wouldn’t say right away.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And actually, it was three different men.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Thwee diffewent men? Damn, girl, way to give the milk away?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, looks like we just lost Kripke.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: No, actuawwy, I’m stiw here.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Now?

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Yup.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Now?

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Yup.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Now? Oh, looks like we just lost Kripke.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Before Emily, I was alone for so long. I just, I don’t know if I can do that again.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, you know, here is something that might cheer you up. The flag of the Isle of Man is nothing but three legs sharing a weird pair of underpants, so you think you got problems.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I have an idea. Maybe someone in our audience would be interested in meeting Rajesh. Ladies, I can attest that he is a kind, handsome, intelligent…

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Rich parents, don’t forget, rich parents.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: …spoiled astrophysicist who not only… oh. Well, that was quick. Hi. You’re on Fun with Flags.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Hey, I think I got cut off.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hello, Kripke.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: I have a fwag question. How many men did you have sex with?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Let’s see. What’s young and fun? Uh, we could go dancing.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Are you actually gonna dance?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah. No one wants to see that. Hey, how about skinny dipping at the beach?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, I don’t need any fish nibbling my business.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, there’s a screening of Moulin Rouge, I heard the crowd sings along and stuff.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That sounds fun. When’s it start?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Midnight.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Midnight. Really? You know what? Let’s do it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, great. Oh, wait. Uh, it’s sold out.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, thank God.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It says, rabies in rabbits is highly unlikely.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, terrific.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s not terrific. Lots of highly unlikely things happen. You saw what’s under this robe, and you still married me.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: If you’re really worried, we’ll take him to the vet and have him tested.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Good. Thank you. Oh, okay, there is a test. All they have to do is cut off his head and check his brain.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, cut off his head? That’s where his little nose is.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: He’s not showing any symptoms. I guess I’ll just go to the emergency room to be safe.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Howie, this is just your hypochondria.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, when I sat on the mute button and thought I’d gone deaf, that was my hypochondria.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: We’ll find another time to tell him I’m pregnant.

utterance.speaker: Raj (voice)
utterance.content: I mean, this is the first time I’ve ever broken up with someone. I just, I didn’t realize it was gonna hurt this much.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It really can.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right. Nothing about this is fun. No one wants to talk about flags, and I haven’t spoken in over ten minutes, so, enjoy your new show, Internet. Dr. Amy Farrah Flower present with.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m sorry for bothering you. I’ll hang up now.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No, hold on, Rajesh. You know, you’re not being very sympathetic. You know first hand that breakups are hard.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fine. If you insist on making me a part of this, yes, I knowledge how painful they can be. However, pain has an evolutionary purpose. It provides information from the environment that, uh, behaviour isn’t good for us.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Wike when I feww in wove with that stwipper and bought her a Pwius.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m just gonna push all the buttons.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Raj, now, I’m sorry you’re suffering. When Amy and I were broken up, I also suffered. And this may sound surprising, but I’m grateful for having gone through it.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. I believe our relationship now is stronger than ever.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: So do I.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: When, when we were apart, I learned how important you are to me. And I realize that when two people are in love, sometimes they…

utterance.speaker: Leonard and Penny
utterance.content: Happy Valentine’s Day!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We are young and fun.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I stand corrected. Fun.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Congratulations on a successful live show.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: And a lovely Valentine’s Day.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Cleaning up is not young and fun.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It can be. Confetti fight. Maybe you should take a break. I got this.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Did you know the singular of confetti is confetto?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Interesting, and when would you use the singular?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m glad you asked. Amy, you have a confetto in your nose. No, no, no, no. Other side. There you go.
